Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Nice People = Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: retdeltee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the gov't's dime for travel. Kinda hard to get into off the I 17 the first time but easy after that. Pleasent staff, good breakfast (included) pool & spa. QUIET even with the 2 highways outside. Clean, good housekeeping, nice bedding with plenty of pillows. 1 pervasive complaint of the 10 of us staying there was the A/C. It will either drive you out so cold or make you max it out and hope for the best. It's a prob with the shades and the filters. Easy to take care of. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good breakfast, but weird location!”
Reviews.Author: EMD1022
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. It is old, and could stand to be upgraded with new carpet and furnishings. Having said that, it was clean, had a great breakfast, free USA Today newspaper, and very friendly staff. They answered our questions about the area, but I don't like the access issues getting into and out of this hotel parking lot. You cannot exit the parking lot and head east on Bell Road, due to traffic, and no traffic lights. You must turn west, do a U Turn, and take risks with the heavy traffic in the area. The price was affordable, the parking was ample, but make sure you don't park in the spaces marked for the neighboring car rental business. They give you a parking decal to put in your windshield to ensure you won't get towed if you park in the right area. To get to the hotel, you must drive past it on the frontage road, and then turn a hard right to drive around to the front door of the hotel. The hotel was quiet while we were there, and while airplanes were flying overhead during the day, we didn't hear them at night. The "white noise" created by the air conditioner drowned out any noise we may have heard, and we slept well. I would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place”
Reviews.Author: CallerDale
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the spring training season. All and all, the price was good, the room was clean, and comfortable, The property was well maintained. The staff was really nice, making our room available a little early...not by our request, but just to be accommodating. We will definitely stay here again, and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money! Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne C
Reviews.Content: By far the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at. This location is a disgrace to the Marriott chain. The hotel itself is very old and dirty. The elevator doesnt look like it has ever been cleaned or vacuumed. The sheets on our bed were dirty when asked for a new set they gave us two flat sheets. Of course the sheets werent changed the following day. Then my husband and I both forgot our phone chargers (iphone & blackberry) and of course they are no where to be found. So not only is this place a dump but things disappear! The customer service was terrible when I called about the chargers. I know typically Marriott properties are a safe bet but stay away from this one! It is terrible!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Staff!”
Reviews.Author: RogueWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Pheonix for the first time on a 7-day business trip. This hotel is CLEAN and the rooms appear to have been redone within the past 12-18 months. Bed was comfortable and room was quiet. Property is right on the light rail and I used it or the hotel's free shuttle to get everywhere I wanted to go. What make this place is the staff. All shifts and all departments were all smiles all the time. Better service than I've received at twice the price. I was first given a handicap accessible room with an adjoining door. I went down and explained I just don't like adjoining rooms and the clothing rack was too low for my clothes to hang without touching the floor. No problem; changed rooms with a smile. Ride to the convention center at the last minute? No problem. The area is NOT dangerous or scary but There is no view to speak of. There is a BurgerKing on one side and an IHOP on the other but there was no cooking smell outside (surprising). The area is clean. If there is a downside its the excersice room: clean and 2 new treadmills but no elliptical and weight machine offered very limited options (no lat pulls, curls, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Kathy
Reviews.Content: Right on the highway. Quiet, clean, nice staff, breakfast included. This was just an overnight stop over and it was perfect for that. Definitely priced right with a nice breakfast offering hot items as well as normal continental selections.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place for us to explore Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: shock43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with a good coupon rate. The location worked great for us. We had a room with a king size bed, desk, fridge, microwave and a comfortable chair with a foot rest on the top floor facing North. The room itself was a little on the small side, but comfortable.We could park our car under our window, the lot was well lit. The breakfast had quite a bit of variety and the area was pleasant and clean. We were told the pool would be heated but it was not. The hot tub was fine. The staff was helpful and great to talk to. The only negative thing we had to mention was a very inconsiderate janitor.

Reviews.Title: “Five-star Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travlprincess
Reviews.Content: When a serendipitious opportunity arose to spend a little time in Phoenix with my fiance', who is stationed out-of-state, after his one-day task assignment at Luke Air Force Base, I scrambled to put together a flight and a last-minute stay. I selected this particular hotel because I trust Marriott properties and the Fairfield Inn Phoenix North seemed conveniently located between the base and the areas of Phoenix we wanted to explore in our 24 hours together. I arrived earlier than anticipated, but Sue, the assistant GM, welcomed me like family and went to great lengths to ensure that I could check in right away, even though it was before check-in time. I'm sure she and the housekeeping staff had to go to some measure of trouble to do so, but her professionalism and charming personality kept me from feeling like I had inconvenienced anyone. In reading other reviews, I see that others have commented that the property is not in a very good part of town. I travel extensively and work in the travel industry, and, while it is not in a resort or tourist area, it didn't seem too bad at all. I've definitely stayed in far worse locations, and know that even the nicest of resorts are plagued with vandalism now and then. (A good practice is to never leave valuables in your vehicle, no matter where you are.) The hotel is located within sight of I-17 and Bell Road, and I felt quite safe walking to a nearby Applebee's alone at dusk while waiting for my fiance' to arrive. Our stay proved to be exceptional, with a clean, quiet room, a complimentary breakfast, friendly, helpful staff and all the amenities one expects with a Marriott property. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeJerky
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and decided to stay at this Fairfield Inn. We were greeted warmly when we arrived and the room was nice and clean. The bed was firm, but comfortable. The breakfast area had plenty of room and the food selection was good. The location of the hotel is good (just off Bell Rd at I-17). I've stayed at this same hotel while in the area on business and had the same experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: insurance209
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2008 for a business trip. I absolutely loved this hotel! The room was clean and well decorated we even had a few minutes to check out the pool. The breakfast every morning was Wonderful! We started staying in Marriott's after this stay. The only negative we had is when we went to take the rental car back we asked in the morning if they would then pick us up at the airport. They said yes, no problem. Later that evening we went took back the rental car and called the front desk...well the driver had a family death and could not come into work that evening and they didn't call anyone else in. WE had to try to find a cab to get a ride back. It ended up working out fine but you would think the hotel could reimburse use the $15 cab ride and they never did. I understand that is not an every day occurence that is why I still rate the hotel very highly because they really did treat us Great!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management Company - Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: NadiaBoBadia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 3 days. On the second day I was locked out of my room and the maids threw away all my toiletries. I have no idea why this happened. I complained to the manager but was not refunded any part of my stay. I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau and was given a free night stay at another Fairfield Property. I tell everyone I know NEVER to stay at this property. The Embassy Suites Phoenix -North one exit down at Greenway Road is terrific and I recommend that property with their generous cooked to order free breakfast instead. Spend a few dollars more there and save yourself the risk of poor service here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: dcnich2005
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were drivng home from our cross the United States road trip and stopped to stay at this hotel. We needed something quickly for ourselves and our children since we had been driving so long. They found two room next to eachother and we took it. The rooms were okay but the staff was horrible. They were rude at check in and at check out. We were leaving the hotel in the morning and could not get our children to sit and eat, so after my husband and I had eaten breakfast we grabbed two milks and two bananas to take to our two little ones in the room and the manager stopped us in the hall, asked us if we were"idiots" to think we could take something out of the breakfast room, made us put it back in the room, and continued on with the insults. He was the rudest manager I have ever encountered and, even though I have family in Phoenix and would have stayed again, we will never stay at this hotel again due to the staff and the fact that they have no manners or sense of customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and clean start to our long trip.”
Reviews.Author: javabean7052
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the courtesy and cleanliness of the Phoenix Fairfield North, part of the Marriott chain. This was our first stop of a cross nation trip that began in San Diego and was to end in New York City. Our small Jetta was packed tight and our evening down time was important to us. The room was spacious and we had all the emenities we required. The included breakfast was just great and included large TV and daily paper in the spacious, well appointed breakfast room. Fresh waffles, microwave egg and cheese sandwiches, yogurt, fresh fruit, large muffins, toast, juice, and coffee rounded out the selections. We have recently become members of the Marriott Rewards program and the small additional perks given to us by that program were appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a brief stay”
Reviews.Author: AZTrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a night following a birthday party. I picked the hotel based on location. The room was comfortable. The bath room was dated and towels were clean but worn. The bed was comfortable. There was some mild road noise since I was facing the highway. Overall a OK hotel but I probably would not want to spend a week there.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable property”
Reviews.Author: ua1953
Reviews.Content: This Fairfield Inn is in a good location, adjacent to I17and was recently refurbished with beautiful guest rooms,and good beds and bedding. New refrigerators were being added to each room during our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful and there was free internet access in the lobby. A nice touch was the offer of free bottles of cold water at check-in. The free breakfast was served in a very pleasant room and was above average with one exception . They were featuring a hot item of a Jimmy Dean sandwich which needed to be microwaved. One of three varieties was offered, sausage, bacon or ham ,on a biscuit with egg and cheese. We looked forward to this as we like Jimmy Dean sausage, The four days we were in the hotel, only the bacon sandwich was offered, and it was very poor, as the bacon was almost non-existent , sliced so thin as to be almost invisable.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed”
Reviews.Author: TwoInTahoe
Reviews.Content: The king bed was VERY comfortable; the linen was clean (no nasty polyester bedspreads, just clean crisp sheets). It was very quiet, which was a surprise considering how close it was to the freeway. It was nicely decorated and very clean. We would definitely stay again. It was not fancy but it was nice for an over night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonably quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Easter Weekend, 2004: very clean apart from some mildewed grout in the shower, somebody elses pubic hair behind the bathroom door, and large bags of trash apparently dropped from the upper floors at the side stairways. Location at NE corner of Bell and IH17 relatively convenient for north Phoenix, although immediate vicinity is grim: adjacent to a self-storage, a truck rental facility and surrounded by strip malls and car dealerships. Ambience is quite similar to a modern U.S. hospital or nursing home. Entrance to the ample parking lot is not marked and is difficult to find. Relatively quiet given proximity of freeway. Staff very courteous and accommodating, although we had to ask for the extra pillows twice. Breakfast is adequate if prepackaged, and the space in which it is served in is small and loomed over by a wall-mounted television. One very small elevator.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Motor Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not much different than your average Comfort Inn or Holiday Inn Express, but clean and quiet and better than the other motor inn in the immediate area. They put out cookies in the evening too, which is a nice personal touch.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn Phoenix North
HotelInfo.Address: 17017 N. Black Canyon Highway, Phoenix, AZ 85023
